intro: Serruria anethifolia, commonly known as the anise-leaved serruria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, anise-scented leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
